授業目的: The objective of the course is to understand the nature of international trade. It covers the basic methods to understand issues raised from the economic interaction between countries. Why international trade arises and what effects it has on the countries involved. Then based on the perspective of international trade, we will look at the economic development in the Asia-Pacific region.
到達目標: After taking this course, students should i) have learned the basic concepts of international trade theory, ii) understand the trade issues of economies in the Asia-Pacific region.
授業方法:
This course will be offered in an on-demand format through Monday, October 11. When the number of registered students is finalized and the classroom environment standards are met, the class will be held face-to-face.
If the standards are not met, the course will continue to be offered in an on-demand format for health and safety reasons.

第1回: Introduction: What is international trade about?
第2回:
Engine of globalization
Analyze some key reasons for globalization.
第3回:
Why trade? (1) Ricardian moodel
Introduce three main reasons for trade: the Ricardian Model and Comparative Advantage, Increasing returns to scale and Imperfect competition.
第4回:
Why trade? (2) Increasing return to scale
Introduce three main reasons for trade: the Ricardian Model and Comparative Advantage, Increasing returns to scale and Imperfect competition.
第5回:
Why trade? (3) Imperfect competition
Introduce three main reasons for trade: the Ricardian Model and Comparative Advantage, Increasing returns to scale and Imperfect competition.
第6回:
Trade and income distribution
Introduce Heckscher-Ohlin model
第7回: Review of theory of international trade: Mid-term Exam
第8回:
Trade policy in the world economy 1: Instrument of trade policy
Understanding the effect of the most important instruments of trade policy on importing and exporting countries.
第9回:
Trade policy in the world economy 2: developing countries
Examine how the trade policies applied in developing countries. Could the policies help developing countries to jump-start growth?
第10回: Trade policy in the world economy 3: international integration
第12回: Economic profile of the Asia-Pacific region
第13回: Trade Policy and growth in Asia
トピック.授業外学習2: There is no prerequisites for this course. However, for the further study, it will be good for student to take or learn introductory economics in advance.
